public class FileConverter {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter the filename for the first file");
        String filename = keyboard.nextLine();
        File file = new File(filename);
        Scanner inputFile = new Scanner(file);
        StringBuilder fileContent = new StringBuilder();
        while(inputFile.hasNext()) {
            String fileinfo = inputFile.nextLine();
            String uppercaseinfo1 = fileinfo.toUpperCase();
            fileContent.append(uppercaseinfo1).append("\n");
        }
        System.out.print("Enter the filename for the second file");
        filename = keyboard.nextLine();
        PrintWriter outputFile = new PrintWriter(filename);
        outputFile.write(fileContent.toString());
        outputFile.close();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that you are not writing the converted uppercase strings to the second file. You need to store the converted strings and then write them to the second file. In the provided code, a StringBuilder is used to store the converted strings. After reading all lines from the first file, the second file is opened for writing and the stored strings are written to it. The PrintWriter.write method is used to write the strings to the file.
